bibl.editor: Surgeon General Joseph K. Barnes, United States Army

body.p: BAKER, JOHN C., Private, 104th Ohio Volunteers, aged 22 years, was wounded, at the battle of Franklin, Tennessee, November 30th, 1864, by a conoidal ball, which caused a flesh wound of the left side of the head. He was conveyed to Nashville, and thence sent to Jeffersonville, Indiana, on January 11th, 1865, suffering from erysipelas. On February 23d, he was transferred to Lincoln Hospital, Washington, D. C., and, on June 17th, 1865, was mustered out of service.
